intro: Azorella transversestriata, commonly known as the transverse-striated azorella, is a member of the Apiaceae family and is native to the Andean region of South America. This plant is a perennial herb characterized by its rosette-forming growth habit and distinctive, finely divided leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Azorella transversestriata is adapted to high-altitude environments, often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in mountainous ecosystems.
